explanation: Agent A's report is correct. The function calls strlen(realm) and memcpy(nonce, nonce2, NONCE_STD_LEN(digest_size)) without any local check that the objects referenced by those pointers are large enough or that realm is NUL-terminated. Under MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17, calls to <string.h> functions must not be able to access beyond the bounds of the objects passed. Absent a provable caller contract or additional checks/annotations in the code guaranteeing that: (a) realm points to a NUL-terminated character array and (b) nonce points to a buffer at least NONCE_STD_LEN(digest_size) bytes long, these calls are potential out-of-bounds accesses and therefore violate Rule 21.17. The added run-time probe is not necessary to demonstrate the static safety requirement — the static use is sufficient to flag the violation unless the API preconditions are formally documented and enforced.
